sink.core

Class Sink

  • java.lang.Object
    • sink.core.Sink
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

    public final class Sink
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
    The Main Entry Point for the Sink Game is the Sink class

    It consists of a single Stage and Camera which are all initialized based on the Config settings. The stage can be accessed in a static way like Sink.stage and methods related to camera like moveTo, moveBy, are also accessed the same way.
    It has extra things like gameUptime, pauseState, CreateListeners, PauseListeners, ResumeListeners, DisposeListeners.
    It has static methods which can be used for panning the camera using mouse, keyboard, drag.. etc. It can also automatically follow a actor by using followActor(Actor actor)
    Use this class to register all your scenes and then you can switch you scenes by using setScene(java.lang.String) method with the sceneName you registered your scene with.
    You Must setup the Sink framework in your splash/menu or first scene after you have loaded all your assets if you want the logPane and fps to display by calling #setup()

    Author:
    pyros2097

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public static void setup(com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin skin)
        You Must call setup the Sink framework in your splash/menu scene after you have loaded all your assets if you want the logPane and fps to display. This loads the fonts for fps and logPane from the skin file. You can use Asset.skin
        Parameters:
        font - - The Skin to set the Fps and logPane text font.

      • setup

        public static void setup(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont font)
        You Must call setup the Sink framework in your splash/menu scene after you have loaded all your assets if you want the logPane and fps to display. This loads the fonts for fps and logPane from the specified BitmapFont font;
        Parameters:
        font - - The BitmapFont to set the Fps and logPane text font.

      • registerScene

        public static void registerScene(java.lang.String sceneName,
                 Scene scene)
        You Must Register the scene with a sceneName so that it can be cached and change scenes using sceneName's
        Parameters:
        sceneName - The name/key to be associated with the scene
        scene - The Scene for caching and easy switching
